numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy applicants have a better chance of admission to elite colleges than non-legacy applicants.
2. This is true for applicants of every income level.
3. Some non-legacy applicants come from poorer families.
4. Some non-legacy applicants come from wealthier families.
5. Non-legacy applicants from poorer families have a better chance of admission than non-legacy applicants from wealthier families.
6. This is not true for very rich non-legacy applicants.
7. Very rich non-legacy applicants have the best chance of admission among non-legacy applicants.
8. I wonder if a college considers the background of an applicant.
9. I wonder if this explains why legacy applicants have a better chance of admission.
10. I wonder if an applicant with higher test scores than a legacy applicant is still at a disadvantage.
11. I wonder how income compares to legacy status in admission decisions.
12. I am a high school student.
13. I will apply to colleges soon.
14. I want to know how income affects my chance of admission at different colleges.
15. I want to know how legacy status affects my chance of admission at different colleges.
16. Some of my friends will apply to colleges soon.
17. My friends will go through the same application process.
18. I think that the applications and the results will change when the process is finished.
19. The headline is: Are colleges picking favorites?
